summary: This is an email dated August 14, 2019, from an unnamed staff member to their 'Boss' at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), summarizing overtime logs for the week of August 4-10, 2019. It details the breakdown between volunteer and mandated overtime shifts for custody and non-custody staff, and mentions the use of augmentation to fill vacancies. The document appears to be routine administrative correspondence regarding prison staffing.

persons.name: Boss
persons.role: Recipient of email, likely supervisor/manager at MCC
persons.context: The email is addressed to 'Boss' and provides a summary of overtime logs for their review.

events.title: Overtime Log Review Week
events.description: Review of overtime logs for mandatory vs. volunteer overtimes at MCC for the week of August 4-10, 2019, showing daily totals and mandates.

keyFacts: The email details overtime staffing procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for the week of August 4-10, 2019.
Overtime is filled first by custody staff, then non-custody staff via a sign-up program, followed by email/radio calls for volunteers, and finally mandates if vacancies remain.
During the day shift, 'augmentation' is used instead of mandates to fill staffing vacancies.
The attached logs cover a period from July 14, 2019, to August 13, 2019.
The document is routine administrative correspondence and does not directly mention Jeffrey Epstein or any specific events related to his case.
